story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: prestige_override
primary_trope.hook_text: The Mid South's tier was OVERRIDDEN. Here's why.
primary_trope.mechanism: Zeigarnik effect — the unresolved question (is the override fair?) demands closure.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race The Mid South? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. The Mid South scored 76 out of 100. The Icons tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race The Mid South?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: The Mid South. Stillwater, Oklahoma. 100 mi. Fast and tactical when dry. Unrideable mud slog when wet. The weather decides what race you're getting.
beats.text_on_screen: The Mid South | Stillwater, Oklahoma | 100 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: What The Mid South does well.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

strengths: Bobby's finish-line hug for every single rider—legendary and authentic
The DFL celebration—Dead F*cking Last gets a steer skull and the loudest cheer
Community vibe—Stillwater genuinely embraces the event, not just tolerates it
Weather lottery makes every edition unique (for better or worse)
$100K prize purse brings the fastest field in early-season gravel

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.narration: What they don't put on the website.
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?'

weaknesses: Lottery registration system means you can't just sign up when you want
Weather unpredictability—you could train for months and get wildfires (2025)
Sparse aid stations (miles 30, 60) mean self-sufficiency required
Travel logistics—OKC/Tulsa airports 1.5 hours away, rental car mandatory

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Oklahoma City or Tulsa - both ~1.5 hours to Stillwater

Lodging: Book early. Stillwater has limited lodging but more than you'd expect for a college town. Hampton Inn partnership. Camping options available downtown. Expect $150-250/night for basic rooms. Volunteers get guaranteed 2027 registration as a perk.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Personality Cult (Positive). If you value community, celebration, and authentic hospitality over predictable racing conditions. yes, absolutely. If you need to know what you're getting into before you commit. maybe reconsider. The Mid South is chaos wrapped in a Bobby hug. Some years it's fast and perfect. Some years it's a mud disaster. Some years it gets cancelled by wildfires. But the people who come back year after year aren't coming for the course. they're coming for the experience. Show up ready for anything. Leave with stories.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If The Mid South isn't quite right for you. If you want the prestige without the weather lottery: try Unbound. If you want tactical short-course racing without the mud risk: try Gravel Locos. If you want community vibe with better logistics: try Belgian Waffle Ride.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced The Mid South? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.
